Package ohos.agp.components

Class ScrollView

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.Component
      • ohos.agp.components.ComponentContainer
        • ohos.agp.components.StackLayout
          • ohos.agp.components.ScrollView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentParent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NestedScrollView, TabList

    public class ScrollView
extends StackLayout
    Creates a scroll component.

    The scroll component is a UI element that allows content to scroll on the screen.

    Since:
    1

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description

      • ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_DEFAULT

        public static final float ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_DEFAULT
        Indicates the default rotation sensitivity of ScrollView to respond to rotating crown events. You can use Component.setRotationSensitivity(float) to set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_HIGH

        public static final float ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_HIGH
        Indicates the high rotation sensitivity of ScrollView to respond to rotating crown events. You can use Component.setRotationSensitivity(float) to set.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public static final float ROTATION_SENSITIVITY_LOW
        Indicates the low rotation sensitivity of ScrollView to respond to rotating crown events. You can use Component.setRotationSensitivity(float) to set.

    • Method Detail

      • doFling

        public void doFling​(int velocityX,
                    int velocityY)
        Scrolls the component content at a specified velocity.
        Parameters:
        velocityX - Indicates the initial velocity for scrolling along the X axis. A positive value indicates that the component is scrolled leftwards to display the content on the right; a negative value indicates that the component is scrolled rightwards to display the content on the left.
        velocityY - Indicates the initial velocity for scrolling along the Y axis. If the value is a positive number, the finger is swiping up the screen and the content is scrolled down towards the bottom.
        Since:
        4

      • doFlingX

        public void doFlingX​(int velocityX)
        Starts flinging along the x axis at a specified initial velocity.
        Parameters:
        velocityX - Indicates the initial velocity for flinging along the x axis. A positive value indicates flinging leftwards on the screen to scroll the content rightwards; a negative value indicates flinging rightwards on the screen to scroll the content leftwards.
        Since:
        4

      • doFlingY

        public void doFlingY​(int velocityY)
        Starts flinging along the y axis at a specified initial velocity.
        Parameters:
        velocityY - Indicates the initial velocity for flinging along the y axis. A positive value indicates flinging upwards on the screen to scroll the content downwards; a negative value indicates flinging downwards on the screen to scroll the content upwards.
        Since:
        4

      • fluentScrollBy

        public void fluentScrollBy​(int deltaX,
                           int deltaY)
        Scrolls the component content smoothly based on a specified number of pixels.
        Parameters:
        deltaX - Indicates the number of pixels for the content component to scroll on the X axis.
        deltaY - Indicates the number of pixels for the content component to scroll on the Y axis.
        Since:
        4

      • fluentScrollByX

        public void fluentScrollByX​(int dx)
        Scrolls the content smoothly by a specified number of pixels along the x axis.
        Parameters:
        dx - Indicates the number of pixels to scroll on the x axis. A positive value indicates scrolling rightwards, and a negative value indicates scrolling leftwards.
        Since:
        4

      • fluentScrollByY

        public void fluentScrollByY​(int dy)
        Scrolls the content smoothly by a specified number of pixels along the y axis.
        Parameters:
        dy - Indicates the number of pixels to scroll on the y axis. A positive value indicates scrolling downwards, and a negative value indicates scrolling upwards.
        Since:
        4

      • fluentScrollTo

        public void fluentScrollTo​(int x,
                           int y)
        Scrolls the component content smoothly based on a specified coordinate position.
        Parameters:
        x - Indicates the target position to scroll the component content on the X axis.
        y - Indicates the target position to scroll the component content on the Y axis.
        Since:
        4

      • fluentScrollXTo

        public void fluentScrollXTo​(int x)
        Scrolls the content smoothly to a specified coordinate position along the x axis.
        Parameters:
        x - Indicates the target position to scroll the content on the x axis.
        Since:
        4

      • fluentScrollYTo

        public void fluentScrollYTo​(int y)
        Scrolls the content smoothly to a specified coordinate position along the y axis.
        Parameters:
        y - Indicates the target position to scroll the content on the y axis.
        Since:
        4

      • setMatchViewportEnabled

        public void setMatchViewportEnabled​(boolean enable)
        Specifies whether the scroll component allows stretch of its components to fill its viewport.
        Parameters:
        enable - Indicates whether to allow the stretch of components of the scroll component. Set this parameter to true if you need the components to fill the viewport of the scroll component; set it to false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • isMatchViewport

        public boolean isMatchViewport​()
        Checks whether the components of the scroll component can be stretched to fill the viewport.

        When you want the components to fill the viewport of the scroll component, set the fillViewport parameter in the setMatchViewportEnabled(boolean) method to true; set it to false otherwise.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the components can be stretched to fill the viewport; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setReboundEffect

        public void setReboundEffect​(boolean enabled)
        Sets whether the rebound effect will be enabled.
        Parameters:
        enabled - Specifies whether to enable the rebound effect. Value true indicates to enable the rebound effect, and false indicates to disable the rebound effect.
        Since:
        3

      • getReboundEffect

        public boolean getReboundEffect​()
        Checks whether the rebound effect is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the rebound effect is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        3

      • setReboundEffectParams

        public void setReboundEffectParams​(int overscrollPercent,
                                   float overscrollRate,
                                   int remainVisiblePercent)
        Configure rebound effect parameters.
        Parameters:
        overscrollPercent - Indicates the overscroll percent (default value: 40). If the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of this parameter, the content scrolling speed is affected by the overscrollRate parameter. Specifically, if the value of overscrollRate is less than 1.0, your finger moves faster than the content.
        overscrollRate - Indicates the overscroll rate (default value: 0.6). This parameter affects the content scrolling speed if the percent of scrolled content exceeds the value of the overscrollPercent parameter. Specifically, the content scrolling speed is equal to the finger scrolling speed multiplied by the value of overscrollRate.
        remainVisiblePercent - Indicates the minimum percent of scrollable content that should remain visible during overscrolling. The default value is 20.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if at least one of the following conditions is true: (1) overscrollPercent is not in range [0, 100] (2) overscrollRate <= 0 (3) remainVisiblePercent is not in range [0, 100]
        Since:
        4

      • setReboundEffectParams

        public void setReboundEffectParams​(ScrollView.ReboundEffectParams reboundEffectParams)
        Sets rebound effect parameters.
        Parameters:
        reboundEffectParams - Indicates a ReboundEffectParams object holding the rebound effect parameters.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if reboundEffectParams is null or contains invalid value.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        getReboundEffectParams(), setReboundEffectParams(int, float, int)

      • getReboundEffectParams

        public ScrollView.ReboundEffectParams getReboundEffectParams​()
        Obtains the rebound parameters as the ReboundEffectParams object.
        Returns:
        Returns the ReboundEffectParams object holding the rebound parameters.
        Since:
        4
        See Also:
        setReboundEffectParams(ReboundEffectParams), setReboundEffectParams(int, float, int)

      • addScrollPausePositionX

        public void addScrollPausePositionX​(int positionX)
        Adds scroll pause position on the X axis. pause is only supported when scrolling from bottom to top by drag gesture.
        Parameters:
        positionX - Indicates the pause position scroll on the X axis.
        Since:
        5

      • addScrollPausePositionY

        public void addScrollPausePositionY​(int positionY)
        Adds scroll pause position on the Y axis. pause is only supported when scrolling from left to right by drag gesture.
        Parameters:
        positionY - Indicates the pause position scroll on the Y axis.
        Since:
        5
